com.java.GameEngine.View

Interface Canvas

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GamePanel

    public interface Canvas
    This interface imposes render(draw) methods into a class.
    It is used for drawing texts/textures.
    Author:
    Serkan Demirci

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear(java.awt.Color parC)
      Clears the canvas.
      void drawText(java.lang.String parText, java.awt.Font parFont, java.awt.Color parColor, java.awt.Point parPoint)
      Draws a string to canvas.
      void drawTextOnCenter(java.lang.String parText, java.awt.Font parFont, java.awt.Color parColor, java.awt.Point parPoint)
      Draws a string that is aligned to center of given position.
      void drawTexture(Texture parT, java.awt.Point parPoint, float parAngle)
      Draws a texture to canvas.
      java.awt.Point getMousePosition()
      Returns the position of the mouse.
      void update()
      Updates canvas to make the changes visible.
      Since the canvas drawing is synchronized all of the changes is not visible without execution of this method.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear(java.awt.Color parC)
        Clears the canvas. After execution of this method canvas is cleared with specified color.
        Parameters:
        parC - Clear color.

      • drawTexture

        void drawTexture(Texture parT,
               java.awt.Point parPoint,
               float parAngle)
        Draws a texture to canvas.
        Parameters:
        parT - Texture to be drawn.
        parPoint - Position of the texture.
        parAngle - Angle of the texture.
        See Also:
        Texture

      • drawTextOnCenter

        void drawTextOnCenter(java.lang.String parText,
                    java.awt.Font parFont,
                    java.awt.Color parColor,
                    java.awt.Point parPoint)
        Draws a string that is aligned to center of given position.
        Parameters:
        parText - String to be drawn.
        parFont - Font.
        parColor - Text color.
        parPoint - The position where the string will be drawn

      • drawText

        void drawText(java.lang.String parText,
            java.awt.Font parFont,
            java.awt.Color parColor,
            java.awt.Point parPoint)
        Draws a string to canvas.
        Parameters:
        parText - String to be drawn.
        parFont - parFont Font.
        parColor - Text color.
        parPoint - The position where the string will be drawn.

      • getMousePosition

        java.awt.Point getMousePosition()
        Returns the position of the mouse.
        Returns:
        Point that represents position of the mouse.

      • update

        void update()
        Updates canvas to make the changes visible.
        Since the canvas drawing is synchronized all of the changes is not visible without execution of this method.
